letters.description: Establish a safe and attuned therapeutic presence, understanding the child's perspective and play language.
Actively listen to the child's expressions through play, setting appropriate limits and boundaries within the play space.
Assess the child's emotional and developmental needs through play observation, attuning to their emotional state and needs.
Yield to the child's lead in play, validating their feelings and experiences expressed through their play interactions.
Empower the child to express themselves freely and creatively through play, fostering self-esteem and emotional regulation.
Promote healthy development through play-based interventions, facilitating discussion and reflection with caregivers to support the child's progress.
